blocks.name: rhmdvdsr
blocks.content: A ring homomorphism preserves the divisibility relation. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 22-Oct-2017.)

thm rhmdvdsr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {

  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c1))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cdsr, c1))

} = {
  sylanbrc(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, co(c1, crh, c2)), wcel(c3, c4), wcel(c5, c4)), wbr(c3, c6, c5)), wbr(cfv(c0, c3), c7, cfv(c0, c5)), wcel(cfv(c0, c3), cfv(cbs, c2)), wrex(hs0, cfv(cbs, c2), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c2), cfv(c0, c3)), cfv(c0, c5))))

  syl(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, co(c1, crh, c2)), wcel(c3, c4), wcel(c5, c4)), wbr(c3, c6, c5)), wrex(hs0, cfv(cbs, c2), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cfv(cmulr, c2), cfv(c0, c3)), cfv(c0, c5))), wrex(hs1, c4, wa(wcel(cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), cfv(cbs, c2)), wceq(co(cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), cfv(cmulr, c2), cfv(c0, c3)), cfv(c0, c5)))))

  dvdsr2(hs1, c3, c4, c6, c5, cfv(cmulr, c1), c1)

  eqtr3d(co(cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), cfv(cmulr, c2), cfv(c0, c3)), cfv(c0, c5), cfv(c0, co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), c3)), wa(wceq(cfv(c0, co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), c3)), co(cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), cfv(cmulr, c2), cfv(c0, c3))), wceq(co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), c3), c5)))
  simpl(wceq(cfv(c0, co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), c3)), co(cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), cfv(cmulr, c2), cfv(c0, c3))), wceq(co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), c3), c5))
  fveq2d(c0, co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), c3), c5, wa(wceq(cfv(c0, co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), c3)), co(cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), cfv(cmulr, c2), cfv(c0, c3))), wceq(co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), c3), c5)))
  simpr(wceq(cfv(c0, co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), c3)), co(cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), cfv(cmulr, c2), cfv(c0, c3))), wceq(co(cv(hs1), cfv(cmulr, c1), c3), c5))

  syl3anc((((c0 ‚àà(c1[RingHom]c2)‚àß c3 ‚àà c4 ‚àß c5 ‚àà c4)‚àß c3[c6]c5)‚àß hs1 ‚àà c4), (c0 `(hs1[(√ó ` c1)]c3))=((c0 ` hs1)[(√ó ` c2)](c0 ` c3)), c0 ‚àà(c1[RingHom]c2), hs1 ‚àà c4, c3 ‚àà c4)

  eqeq1d((hs0[(√ó ` c2)](c0 ` c3)), (c0 ` c5), ((c0 ` hs1)[(√ó ` c2)](c0 ` c3)), hs0 =(c0 ` hs1))

blocks.name: rhmopp
blocks.content: A ring homomorphism is also a ring homomorphism for the opposite rings. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 27-Oct-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm rhmopp(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, crh, c2)), wcel(c0, co(cfv(coppr, c1), crh, cfv(coppr, c2))))
} = {

blocks.name: kerunit
blocks.content: If a unit element lies in the kernel of a ring homomorphism, then ` 0 = 1 ` , i.e. the target ring is the zero ring. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 24-Oct-2017.)
